name: BBCWorld
text:
Coronavirus has spread around the world, with more than nine million confirmed cases in 188 countries

Nearly 500,000 people have lost their lives

Some countries are seeing confirmed cases fall, but others are still seeing figures rise

[Thread]

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx

name: BBCWorld
text:
In May, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the Americas the new centre of the pandemic

But there have also been new spikes in Africa, Asia and the Middle East

Brazil, Mexico, India and Pakistan have been particularly badly affected

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/ukiNmz8YUn

name: BBCWorld
text:
In these countries, the numbers of recorded cases have been rising, significantly, in recent weeks

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/sfJ4RAvSR1

name: BBCWorld
text:
The number of recorded deaths in Brazil, Mexico, India and Pakistan have also been on an upward trajectory in recent weeks

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/UI8IpYsffY

name: BBCWorld
text:
Brazil üáßüá∑

President Jair Bolsonaro has consistently downplayed the virus

On Tuesday, a judge ordered him to wear a mask in public

üìåThey're only the second country, after the US, to confirm more than one million cases

üìåDeath toll of 50,000+

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/dRMzW5jCkv

name: BBCWorld
text:
Mexico üá≤üáΩ

üìå The second worst-affected country in Latin America, with cases continuing to surge

üìåThe mayor of the capital, Mexico City, has cancelled plans to reopen businesses this week, with the alert level remaining at "red"

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/ytSbEbTSc7

name: BBCWorld
text:
India üáÆüá≥

üìåIndia reported more than 15,000 new coronavirus cases on Sunday - the country's biggest daily increase to date

üìåThe official national death toll has passed 13,000 but the true number is thought to be higher, due to testing & reporting issues

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/NZnbMPKHAT

name: BBCWorld
text:
Pakistan üáµüá∞

üìåPakistan has also seen a surge in infections and deaths over recent weeks, but the number of new cases have fallen slightly in recent days

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/5U6wDpCnDh

name: BBCWorld
text:
What about elsewhere?

üáÆüá∑Iran fears a second wave; daily deaths have risen to around 100 for the first time in two months

üá®üá≥ China's recent outbreak at a Beijing market has been contained, officials say

üáøüá¶üá™üá¨ Egypt & South Africa are worst-hit in Africa

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/pLI27T15ea

name: BBCWorld
text:
Previous pandemics have unfolded in 'waves', with fresh outbreaks, after the initial peak

Although some countries have seen a rise in infections after appearing to have the virus under control, they may still be in the first stages of an outbreak

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/UMd3271IU2

name: BBCWorld
text:
And the US? üá∫üá∏

Cases and deaths in the US sparked the highest infection rate worldwide, but by May these began dropping and restrictions lifted as President Trump looked to boost the economy

However it appears infections are beginning to spike again

https://t.co/XZbxHs5AL5 https://t.co/SkfFnFdlGO

name: BBCWorld
text:
A number of US states report record daily coronavirus infections, with some seeing the highest hospital admissions in the pandemic so far

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/i5zYtiYr1F

name: BBCWorld
text:
What's caused this increase?

The White House has attributed the rise in cases to an increase in US testing capacity

But Dr Anthony Fauci, a top US health official for infectious diseases, has disputed this

https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx https://t.co/ay4NzT7C79
